Package net.kemitix.mon.result

<h1>Result</h1> Allows handling error conditions without the need to catch exceptions.

When a Result is returned from a method, it will be in one of two states: Success or Err. The Success state will contain a value from the method. The Err state will contain a Throwable detailing the reason for the failure.

Methods returning a Result should not throw any exceptions.

Result is a Monad.

Static Constructors:

  • Result.ok()
  • Result.ok(Object)
  • Result.of(Callable)
  • Result.ofVoid(VoidCallable)
  • Result.error(Throwable)
Author:
Paul Campbell (pcampbell@kemitix.net)
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BaseResult
    Base interface for Result and ResultVoid.
    Result<T>
    A type for holding a result or an error.
    ResultVoid
    A @{link Result} with no value.
    ThrowableFunction<T,​R,​E extends Throwable>
    Represents a function that accepts one argument and produces a result.
    VoidCallable
    A task that returns void and may throw an exception.
    WithResultContinuation<T>
    A Callable-like interface for performing an action with a Result that, if there are no errors is returned as-is, but if there is an error then a new error Result is returned.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ErrVoid
    An Error Result with no value type.
    SuccessVoid
    The Successful Result, with no value.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CheckedErrorResultException
    A checked wrapper for exceptions thrown within a Result.
    ErrorResultException
    An unchecked wrapper for exceptions thrown within a Result.
    UnexpectedErrorResultException
    An Unchecked wrapper for unexpected exceptions thrown within a Result.
